sentence: 1. **Joke: What did the communist say at the beginning of the race? on your marx, get set, go!**
Here, the word marx can mean two different things: as a proper noun (referring to Karl Marx) and as a play on marks (indicating a starting position).
Below is the output in the desired format:
What did the communist say at the beginning of the race? on your marx, get set, go!
explanation: First meaning refers to Karl Marx, the philosopher. Second meaning refers to a mark or indication to start.
first_new_sentence: Karl Marx was a significant figure in the development of socialist theory.
second_new_sentence: The runners took their positions and awaited the signal marked by the starters instructions.
